segment.source: Viewing and Configuring MED-V Logs
segment.target: Viewing and Configuring MED-V Logs

segment.source: Viewing and Configuring MED-V Logs
segment.target: Viewing and Configuring MED-V Logs

segment.source: Viewing and Configuring MED-V Logs
segment.target: Viewing and Configuring MED-V Logs

segment.source: When you are troubleshooting MED-V issues and problems, you may find it helpful or necessary to access the MED-V event logs.
segment.target: When you are troubleshooting MED-V issues and problems, you may find it helpful or necessary to access the MED-V event logs.

segment.source: You can open Event Viewer for the host computer and the guest virtual machine by using the MED-V Administration Toolkit.
segment.target: You can open Event Viewer for the host computer and the guest virtual machine by using the MED-V Administration Toolkit.

segment.source: You can also use the MED-V Administration Toolkit to set the logging level at which the MED-V event logs report MED-V events.
segment.target: You can also use the MED-V Administration Toolkit to set the logging level at which the MED-V event logs report MED-V events.

segment.source: For information about how to open the MED-V Administration Toolkit, see Troubleshooting MED-V by Using the Administration Toolkit.
segment.target: For information about how to open the MED-V Administration Toolkit, see Troubleshooting MED-V by Using the Administration Toolkit.

segment.source: Viewing MED-V Event Logs
segment.target: Viewing MED-V Event Logs

segment.source: On the MED-V Administration Toolkit window, click Host Events to open the event viewer for the host computer.
segment.target: On the MED-V Administration Toolkit window, click Host Events to open the event viewer for the host computer.

segment.source: Or, click Guest Events to open Event Viewer for the guest virtual machine.
segment.target: Or, click Guest Events to open Event Viewer for the guest virtual machine.

segment.source: Event Viewer opens and displays the corresponding event logs that you can use to troubleshoot the issues that you might encounter when you deploy or manage MED-V.
segment.target: Event Viewer opens and displays the corresponding event logs that you can use to troubleshoot the issues that you might encounter when you deploy or manage MED-V.

segment.source: By default, only errors and warnings are displayed.
segment.target: By default, only errors and warnings are displayed.

segment.source: For more information about specific event IDs and messages, see MED-V Event Log Messages.
segment.target: For more information about specific event IDs and messages, see MED-V Event Log Messages.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: End users can only save event log files in the guest if they have administrative permissions.
segment.target: End users can only save event log files in the guest if they have administrative permissions.

segment.source: To manually open the Event Viewer in the host computer
segment.target: To manually open the Event Viewer in the host computer

segment.source: Click Start, click Control Panel, and then click Administrative Tools.
segment.target: Click Start, click Control Panel, and then click Administrative Tools.

segment.source: Double-click Event Viewer, and then click Applications and Services Logs.
segment.target: Double-click Event Viewer, and then click Applications and Services Logs.

segment.source: Double-click MEDV.
segment.target: Double-click MEDV.

segment.source: Configuring MED-V Event Logs
segment.target: Configuring MED-V Event Logs

segment.source: You can specify the MED-V event logging level by selecting the corresponding option button on the MED-V Administration Toolkit.
segment.target: You can specify the MED-V event logging level by selecting the corresponding option button on the MED-V Administration Toolkit.

segment.source: You can decide whether event logging includes errors only, errors and warnings, or errors, warnings and informational messages.
segment.target: You can decide whether event logging includes errors only, errors and warnings, or errors, warnings and informational messages.

segment.source: The event logging level specified is set for both the host computer and the guest virtual machine.
segment.target: The event logging level specified is set for both the host computer and the guest virtual machine.

segment.source: You can also specify the event logging level by editing the EventLogLevel registry value.
segment.target: You can also specify the event logging level by editing the EventLogLevel registry value.

segment.source: For more information, see Managing MED-V Workspace Configuration Settings.
segment.target: For more information, see Managing MED-V Workspace Configuration Settings.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The level you specify on the MED-V Administration Toolkit window applies to future MED-V event logging.
segment.target: The level you specify on the MED-V Administration Toolkit window applies to future MED-V event logging.

segment.source: If you set the level to capture all errors, warnings, and informational messages, then the event logs fill more quickly and older events are removed.
segment.target: If you set the level to capture all errors, warnings, and informational messages, then the event logs fill more quickly and older events are removed.

segment.target: Related topics
